parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "resource_allocation": {
      "account": "ict23_esp_0",
      "partition": "boost_usr_prod",
      "wall_time": "00:15:00",
      "nodes": 2,
      "memory_per_node": "60G",
      "tasks_per_node": 6,
      "gpus_per_node": 4
    },
    "job_name": "cl_test",
    "email_notifications": ["FAIL", "END"],
    "email_address": "sdigioia@sissa.it",
    "output_file": "/leonardo_work/ICT23_SMR3872/sdigioia/test_env/run.out",
    "error_file": "/leonardo_work/ICT23_SMR3872/sdigioia/test_env/run.err",
    "modules": [
      "profile/deeplrn",
      "gcc",
      "openmpi",
      "cuda/11.8"
    ],
    "working_directory": "/leonardo_work/ICT23_SMR3872/sdigioia/test_env/",
    "conda_environment": "/leonardo_work/ICT23_ESP_0/shared-env/MLenv",
    "executable": "test-dask-on-GPUs.py",
    "mpi_processes": 8
  }
}
```

This script uses **Slurm** for resource allocation and job management. It requests resources like compute nodes, memory, GPUs, and specifies the execution time, job name, and email notifications. 

The script then loads several modules: `profile/deeplrn`, `gcc`, `openmpi`, and `cuda/11.8` to set up the necessary software environment. It then switches to a specific directory and activates a conda environment. Finally, it uses `mpirun` to run the Python script `test-dask-on-GPUs.py` with 8 MPI processes.
